channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: RSF：ロンドンは、イラン政府、その代理人、反対派グループなど、イラン人ジャーナリストに対する国境を越えた脅威の「ホットスポット」となっている（Megan Specia/New York Times）
item.description:
Megan Specia / New York Times:
RSF: London has become a “hot spot” of transnational threats against Iranian journalists, including from Iranian government, its proxies, and opposition groups  —  Iranian reporters and broadcasters in Britain have suffered physical attacks, threats and surveillance …

item.title: 1,000万件以上の仕事に関するQ&A記事を集めたリンクトインの「コラボレーティブ・アーティクルズ」。
item.description:
Sharon Goldman / Fortune:
A look at LinkedIn's Collaborative Articles, a collection of over 10M work-related Q&A articles, as many users claim the tips are low-quality and AI-generated  —  When Irene Malatesta learned that LinkedIn was launching collaborative articles last year, she was itching to participate.

item.title: 内部草案：英ICO、グーグルのプライバシー・サンドボックスは不十分で、匿名であるべきユーザーのプライバシーを損なうために悪用される可能性のあるギャップを残していると指摘（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Internal draft: UK's ICO says Google's Privacy Sandbox falls short and leaves gaps that can be exploited to undermine privacy of users who should be anonymous  —  In draft report, agency says Google's proposed replacements for cookies have gaps advertisers can exploit

item.title: 職員が組合結成に投票した後のレイオフなど、ロングビーチポスト紙で続くストライキの理由を深掘り（Ben Burgis/Jacobin）
item.description:
Ben Burgis / Jacobin:
A deep look at the reasons behind the ongoing strike at The Long Beach Post, including layoffs after staffers voted to form a union  —  Striking Long Beach Post journalists say they are fighting against layoffs, corporate media consolidation, and union-busting labor law violations.

item.title: ヒュンダイは、ある広告が反ユダヤ的で親ナチ的なコンテンツの隣に表示された後、Xでの広告を一時停止していると発表した。
item.description:
David Ingram / NBC News:
Hyundai says it is pausing ads on X, after one ad appeared next to antisemitic and pro-Nazi content; the ad appeared on a user profile that had 55K+ followers  —  The move came after a Hyundai ad appeared next to antisemitic posts from a user who has posted pro-Hitler content.

item.title: 情報筋ソニー・ピクチャーズエンタテインメントとアポロ、スカイダンスと独占交渉中のパラマウントに対し、全額現金での共同オファーを検討（ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Sony Pictures Entertainment and Apollo discussed a joint all-cash offer for Paramount, which is still in an exclusive negotiation window with Skydance  —  The company and Apollo Global Management are discussing a joint effort, even as Paramount conducts exclusive merger negotiations with Skydance.

item.title: Essence誌の親会社であるSundial Media GroupがVice MediaからRefinery29を買収することで合意し、Refinery29のCEOに元Vice COOのCory Haikを指名（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Essence magazine's parent, Sundial Media Group, agrees to buy Refinery29 from Vice Media and names former Vice COO Cory Haik as CEO of Refinery29  —  - The acquisition of Refinery29 will help Sundial and Essence extend their reach to content companies that cut across culture and commerce, Sundial said in a statement.

item.title: ネットフリックス、2025年第1四半期から加入者数や会員一人当たりの平均売上を報告せず、滞在時間が「顧客満足度の最良の代用品」だとしている（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Netflix won't report subscriber numbers or Average Revenue per Membership starting in Q1 2025, saying time spent is its “best proxy for customer satisfaction”  —  Netflix will no longer report subscriber numbers — a key metric for streaming services for years — beginning with the first quarter of 2025.

item.title: ネットフリックス、第1四半期の売上高は前年同期比15％増の93.7億ドル（予想92.8億ドル）、有料ユーザー数は前年同期比16％増の2.696万人（予想2.642万人）、純利益は前年同期比13億ドル増の23億ドル（Sarah Whitten/CNBC）。
item.description:
Sarah Whitten / CNBC:
Netflix reports Q1 revenue up 15% YoY to $9.37B, vs. $9.28B est., paid users up 16% YoY to 269.6M, vs. 264.2M est., and net income $2.3B, up from $1.3B YoY  —  LOS ANGELES — Netflix reported earnings that beat on the top and bottom line after the bell Thursday.  —  Here are the results:

item.title: トランプ氏のNY刑事裁判の判事は18日、陪審員の職業情報を開示しないよう記者団に命じ、陪審員の身体的特徴を共有しないよう警告した（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
The judge in Trump's NY criminal trial ordered reporters on April 18 to not disclose jurors' job info and warned against sharing jurors' physical descriptions  —  Some news reports have included details about jurors that had been aired in open court.  One was excused after she developed concerns about being identified.

item.title: 短編動画アプリTrillerが香港の金融サービス会社AGBAと合併、Trillerの株主は40億ドル規模の合併会社の80%を所有（Daniel Tencer/Music Business Worldwide）
item.description:
Daniel Tencer / Music Business Worldwide:
Short-form video app Triller is merging with Hong Kong financial services company AGBA; Triller shareholders will own 80% of the combined company valued at $4B  —  Financially troubled social media app and TikTok competitor Triller is merging with a Hong Kong financial services company …

item.title: カリフォルニア州の政治・政策に特化した非営利団体CalMattersがテック系ニュースの非営利団体The Markupを買収、CalMattersの資金調達額は～1250万ドル、The Markupは500万ドル（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
CalMatters, a nonprofit focused on CA politics and policy, acquires tech news nonprofit The Markup; CalMatters has ~$12.5M in funding and The Markup has $5M  —  - CalMatters today employs 72 people and The Markup employs 28. … - CalMatters currently has around $12.5 in philanthropic funding …

item.title: バーモント州がどのように変化してきたかを記録する独立系ポッドキャスト「Rumble Strip」を2013年に立ち上げたホスト、エリカ・ハイルマンとのQ&A（Neel Dhanesha/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Neel Dhanesha / Nieman Lab:
Q&A with Erica Heilman, host of “Rumble Strip”, an independent podcast she created in 2013 that chronicles how Vermont changed over the years  —  “I only make unimportant things now, but it's all the unimportant things that really make up our lives.”

item.title: ファッションとユースカルチャーを扱うウィラ・ベネットEIC率いる雑誌とウェブサイト。
item.description:
Jessica Testa / New York Times:
A look at Highsnobiety, a creative consultancy and clothing line, as well as magazine and website led by EIC Willa Bennett covering fashion and youth culture  —  Willa Bennett, the editor of Highsnobiety, at the Bowling Green subway station near its offices in New York.Lanna Apisukh for The New York Times

item.title: チュニジアの裁判所が、著名な政府批判者でジャーナリストのモハメド・ブガレブに名誉棄損で懲役6カ月の判決を下し、報道の自由に対する懸念が再燃している（Souhail Karam/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Souhail Karam / Bloomberg:
A Tunisian court sentences prominent government critic and journalist Mohamed Boughalleb to six months in prison for defamation, renewing press freedom concerns  —  A Tunisian court jailed for defamation a reporter who's one of President Kais Saied's most prominent critics …
